critical.title: Memory Pool Cleanup on Failure
critical.description: Memory pool allocation function does not properly clean up on partial allocation failures. If d_x_pool or d_y_pool allocation fails, previously allocated memory may not be freed consistently.
critical.impact: GPU memory leaks in error paths, potential double-free if function called again after partial failure, resource exhaustion in long-running processes
critical.remediation: Add proper cleanup order and null checks. Set all pointers to nullptr after freeing.

critical.title: Unimplemented CUDA Functions Return Stub Errors
critical.description: Two critical GPU functions (kh_ecc_pmul_batch_soa and kh_ecc_pmul_batch_coop) are stubbed out and always return cudaErrorNotYetImplemented
critical.impact: Reduced performance for SoA memory layout optimizations, missing warp-cooperative optimization path, API surface suggests features that don't exist
critical.remediation: Short-term: Document stub status in header files and README. Medium-term: Implement SoA and cooperative kernels. Long-term: Add feature flags to detect available implementations at runtime

critical.title: Temporary Buffer Allocation Without Error Propagation
critical.description: GPU_BatchPrivToPub_Bytes32BE allocates three large temporary buffers with malloc but only checks for allocation failure locally. Large batch sizes could cause out-of-memory failures
critical.impact: Large batch sizes (count > 10,000) could cause OOM, no validation that count * 8 * sizeof(uint32_t) doesn't overflow, repeated calls with large count can fragment heap memory
critical.remediation: Add overflow check and reasonable limits. Use calloc for zero-initialization

high.title: Debug Code Patterns in Production
high.description: Extensive debug code remains in production builds, including global debug flags that can be enabled via command-line and commented-out debug printf statements throughout critical paths
high.impact: Debug output may leak sensitive information (private keys, memory addresses), performance degradation when debug mode enabled, code clutter reduces maintainability
high.remediation: Use compile-time debug macros instead of runtime flags, remove or properly gate 75 commented debug lines, implement structured logging with severity levels

high.title: Unsafe String Functions
high.description: Use of potentially unsafe string functions like sprintf without bounds checking
high.impact: Buffer overflow potential if input validation is insufficient, CWE-120: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input, memory corruption leading to crashes or code execution
high.remediation: Replace sprintf with snprintf throughout codebase, replace strcpy with strncpy or safer alternatives, add static analysis to CI/CD to catch future instances

high.title: Missing CUDA Error Checks
high.description: Several CUDA API calls don't check return values immediately, potentially masking errors
high.impact: Silent failures in GPU operations, incorrect results propagated to CPU, difficult debugging when GPU operations fail
high.remediation: Create CUDA_CHECK macro for consistent error checking and apply throughout

high.title: Integer Overflow in Buffer Size Calculations
high.description: Buffer size calculations multiply user-provided count without overflow checks
high.impact: Large count values can cause integer overflow, resulting in undersized allocations, leading to buffer overflows in subsequent operations
high.remediation: Add overflow detection using SIZE_MAX checks or compiler builtins

high.title: Global Mutable State in GPU Backend
high.description: Multiple global variables maintain GPU state without thread synchronization
high.impact: Not thread-safe for multi-threaded applications, memory pool shared across all callers (no isolation), performance counters race without synchronization, difficult to support multiple GPUs
high.remediation: Encapsulate state in a context object with create/destroy functions, add mutex protection for performance counters

high.title: Missing Input Validation
high.description: GPU_BatchPrivToPub validates pointers and count, but doesn't validate block_dim parameter
high.impact: Invalid block dimensions could cause kernel launch failures, large block_dim values waste GPU resources
high.remediation: Add validation for block_dim range (MIN_BLOCK_DIM to MAX_BLOCK_DIM)

high.title: Memory Fragmentation from Repeated Allocations
high.description: GPU_BatchPrivToPub_Bytes32BE allocates three large temporary buffers on every call without reusing memory
high.impact: Heap fragmentation, repeated malloc/free overhead, cache thrashing in high-frequency calls
high.remediation: Use memory pool pattern similar to the GPU device memory pool for host-side buffers

high.title: TODO/FIXME Items Indicating Incomplete Code
high.description: Multiple TODO/FIXME markers throughout codebase indicating incomplete optimizations and unhandled edge cases
high.impact: Incomplete optimizations reduce performance, unhandled edge cases (e.g., large keys in SHA-512), technical debt accumulation
high.remediation: Catalog all TODOs in issue tracker, prioritize by impact (security > correctness > performance), create implementation roadmap

high.title: Endianness Conversion Not Validated
high.description: Convert_BE32_to_LE32_Array and Convert_LE32_to_BE32_Array perform byte swapping without validation or comprehensive tests
high.impact: Silent data corruption in big-endian to little-endian conversion, incorrect public keys generated from valid private keys, difficult to debug without comprehensive tests
high.remediation: Add roundtrip tests and property-based tests with random inputs

high.title: Performance Monitoring Variables Not Atomic
high.description: Performance counters are updated without synchronization
high.impact: Inaccurate performance metrics in multi-threaded usage, potential undefined behavior (data races on non-atomic types), misleading profiling information
high.remediation: Use atomic types from stdatomic.h for all performance counters

high.title: No GPU Memory Pool Cleanup on Exit
high.description: GPU memory pool (d_priv_pool, d_x_pool, d_y_pool) is never explicitly freed. No cleanup function is provided or documented
high.impact: GPU memory leaks on program exit, resources not returned to system, issues in long-running daemons or when library is dynamically loaded/unloaded
high.remediation: Implement GPU_Cleanup() function and call at exit or provide automatic cleanup via atexit()

high.title: Time-of-Check to Time-of-Use (TOCTOU) in GPU Availability
high.description: GPU_IsAvailable() is called separately from GPU operations, introducing a TOCTOU window
high.impact: GPU could become unavailable between check and use, error handling delayed until actual operation, misleading error codes returned
high.remediation: Remove separate availability check; let CUDA operations fail naturally with appropriate error codes

medium.title: Commented-Out Code Throughout Codebase
medium.description: 75 instances of commented debug code, 50+ commented-out if statements, multiple blocks of 10+ consecutive commented lines
medium.impact: Code clutter reduces readability, unclear if comments represent historical bugs or future features, increases cognitive load for maintainers
medium.remediation: Remove obsolete commented code, use version control to preserve history, document intent for truly necessary commented sections

medium.title: Hard-Coded Magic Numbers
medium.description: Magic numbers like 256 for block_dim and 1000/10.0 for reporting intervals

medium.title: Inconsistent Error Code Convention
medium.description: Error codes are not consistently defined across API functions
medium.impact: Callers cannot reliably distinguish error types, makes debugging difficult, API is user-unfriendly
medium.remediation: Define error code enum with clear semantics

medium.title: Lack of Const Correctness
medium.description: Many functions don't use const for read-only parameters
medium.impact: Reduced compiler optimization opportunities and clarity
medium.remediation: Audit all function signatures and add const where appropriate

medium.title: Performance Reporting Uses fprintf to stderr
medium.description: Performance and debug output hardcoded to stderr with no way to disable or redirect
medium.impact: No way to disable performance logging without recompiling, mixed with actual error messages, cannot redirect to log files easily

medium.title: No Bounds Check on Block Dimension Parameter
medium.description: Block dimension parameter has default but no maximum check (CUDA typically limits to 1024)
medium.impact: Kernel launch may fail with invalid configuration
medium.remediation: Add maximum check against CUDA limits

medium.title: Shared Memory Size Not Validated
medium.description: Shared memory size calculation does not check against GPU hardware limits
medium.impact: Kernel launch may fail silently if shared memory exceeds limits
medium.remediation: Query device properties and validate against sharedMemPerBlock limit

medium.title: No Multi-GPU Support
medium.description: Code assumes single GPU (device 0), no API to select specific GPU or use multiple GPUs
medium.impact: Cannot utilize multi-GPU systems, reduced performance on high-end hardware

medium.title: Timing Code Uses gettimeofday()
medium.description: Uses deprecated gettimeofday() instead of modern clock_gettime()
medium.impact: Lower precision than modern alternatives, not portable to all platforms

medium.title: Memory Pool Not Size-Limited
medium.description: Memory pool can grow without bounds, no maximum size check
medium.impact: Could allocate entire GPU memory, no graceful degradation, OOM killer risk

medium.title: Endian Conversion Loop Inefficiency
medium.description: Endian conversion uses byte-by-byte operations rather than optimized SIMD or intrinsics
medium.impact: Suboptimal performance for large batch conversions
medium.remediation: Use platform intrinsics like __builtin_bswap32 where available

medium.title: Struct Packing Not Specified
medium.description: Performance monitoring structs may have different layouts on different platforms/compilers

medium.title: No Null Pointer Checks in Conversion Functions
medium.description: Conversion functions check for null but fail silently with no error signaling
medium.impact: Silent failures hard to debug, caller has no way to know conversion succeeded
medium.remediation: Return error codes instead of void

medium.title: Unused Parameter Suppression Could Hide Bugs
medium.description: Stub functions explicitly void-cast parameters to suppress warnings
medium.impact: Could accidentally suppress warnings for real unused parameters, makes it harder to detect when stubs are mistakenly called

medium.title: Performance Report Interval Not Configurable
medium.description: Hard-coded reporting interval (every 1000 calls or 10 seconds) cannot be changed at runtime
medium.impact: Limited flexibility for different use cases

medium.title: Grid Dimension Calculation May Overflow
medium.description: Grid dimension calculation (count + block_dim - 1) may overflow if count is close to UINT32_MAX
medium.impact: Incorrect grid dimensions leading to kernel launch failures

medium.title: No Validation of cudaDeviceSynchronize Success
medium.description: Both kernel launch error and synchronization error use same return path
medium.impact: Makes debugging harder to distinguish launch vs execution failures
medium.remediation: Return different error codes for launch vs sync errors

medium.title: Missing Documentation for Error Codes
medium.description: Public API functions return various error codes without documentation explaining meanings
medium.impact: Difficult for API consumers to handle errors properly
medium.remediation: Add comprehensive documentation in header files with @return annotations

low.title: Inconsistent Comment Language
low.description: Mix of English and Chinese comments throughout codebase
low.remediation: Standardize on English for international collaboration

low.title: Inconsistent Naming Conventions
low.description: Mix of snake_case and PascalCase, inconsistent use of prefixes
low.remediation: Establish and enforce coding style guide

low.title: Verbose Debug Output
low.description: Debug output always printed to stderr
low.remediation: Use log levels to control verbosity

low.title: Redundant Type Casts
low.description: Some type casts are redundant due to implicit conversions
low.remediation: Keep for clarity in error returns, remove in other contexts

low.title: Magic Number 8 for Limb Count
low.description: The constant 8 (for 8 Ã— 32-bit limbs = 256 bits) appears throughout without symbolic name

low.title: Trailing Whitespace
low.description: Trailing whitespace present in source files
low.remediation: Configure editor to remove trailing whitespace on save

low.title: Inconsistent Bracket Style
low.description: Mix of K&R and Allman bracket styles
low.remediation: Run code formatter (clang-format) with consistent config

low.title: Long Function Names
low.description: Function name GPU_BatchPrivToPub_Bytes32BE is very long
low.remediation: Consider shorter alias or restructure API

low.title: Unnecessary Include Guards in .cu Files
low.description: .cu implementation files don't need include guards (only headers do)
low.remediation: Remove from .cu files, keep in .cuh/.h files

low.title: Missing Newline at End of File
low.description: File doesn't end with newline (POSIX standard)

low.title: Commented Code in Production
low.description: Large blocks of commented-out code in production files
low.remediation: Remove and rely on version control

low.title: Variable Shadowing
low.description: Local variables may shadow outer scope variables
low.remediation: Enable compiler warning -Wshadow and fix instances

low.title: Missing Copyright Headers
low.description: Not all files have consistent copyright/license headers
low.remediation: Add standard header to all source files per LICENSE file

low.title: Potential for Off-by-One in Array Indexing
low.description: Index calculation needs verification: const uint8_t* src = &be_bytes[(7-i) * 4];
low.impact: Potential bounds issue (appears correct but warrants testing)
low.remediation: Add unit tests to verify bounds
